Method of Action: Gamifying the Love of Learning & Design

31 Jan 2013

Method of Action is a peer-to-peer educational website that targets three categories: Design, Entrepreneurship, and Gardening.

Each course is comprised of 50 “missions” that contain videos, articles, resources and tools that can help you accomplish your goal, and ultimately advance your knowledge of the subject at hand.

Once you’ve completed a task, you submit your results to a panel of more experienced peers who will then review it and give you a passing or failing grade. If you pass, you get points allowing you to access more challenging missions. Eventually, if you gain enough experience (exp), you’ll even be able to become part of the review panel and help others accomplish their goals in return.

The core foundation is simple really; most people learn by doing.

“Knowledge is acquired by actually doing things and reflecting upon it. Proactively thinking about how you can improve what you did.”

MOA claims that while you can get pretty far with just doing, eventually you’re going to need someone to tell you how to get beyond what you already know. You’re going to need help setting milestones, and provide guidance on exercises to help you get there.

I think this idea is absolutely amazing. I for one know that I learn much faster if I’m actively participating. I’ve read articles and tutorials on how to code a website, but until I actually attempted a few exercises alongside what I was reading, nothing I read really stuck or made much sense.

If you’re reading this and are interested in learning more about design, or are already a designer who wants to brush up on some of those lessons we learned back in Typography 101, check out  the following games:

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
